title: WEX launches new payment option
text:
WEX launches new payment option 10 August 2015 Save 
WEX has teamed up with airline-owned UATP to launch a new payment option. 
Following the deal, the WEX Virtual Credit Card Solution (VCC) is now available to the entire UATP Network meaning greater card acceptance for hotel and car rental purchases. 
It will mean corporate travellers will be given a single-use virtual credit card number which can be used in any currency that WEX settles. 
James Pratt, WEX SVP, general manager of virtual payments, said: “Collaborating with UATP was a logical move to grow our virtual global travel payment platform. 
“VCCs are an increasingly popular form of payment for travellers and we expect the solution to be picked up quickly and grow rapidly with UATP.” 
Ralph Kaiser, president and chief executive of UATP, added: “Working with WEX, we have created a solution that will enhance the UATP Network by allowing corporates to add hotels and rental cars to their UATP accounts. 
“As the pioneer of single-use payment technology, we know that WEX will provide top-notch service to our network and its customers.”
